overall_summary: The reasoning demonstrates a practical approach to short-term forecasting using limited data. It focuses on identifying daily seasonality as the dominant pattern, acknowledges data limitations (only 96 hourly points), and selects a simple averaging method after considering but dismissing more complex models like ARIMA or Exponential Smoothing due to insufficient data length. The solution prioritizes interpretability and computational simplicity while ensuring complete output as required.
common_data_patterns: Hourly fluctuations without clear long-term trend
Complete data in provided segment (no missing values)
key_insights: Prioritizing simplicity when data is limited (4 days)
Grouping by hour-of-day to capture daily seasonality patterns
Rounding forecasts to match input data precision (3 decimals)
Rejecting complex models due to insufficient training data
Generating complete output despite potential missing values in source data
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex: Detailed data inspection and method evaluation, but ultimately implements straightforward hourly averaging. Includes multi-step validation (pattern checks, method comparisons, rounding logic) while maintaining practical constraints.
